author: sky.cactus
content: The core devs don't target inflation/deflation.  They target appropriate incentive structures.  Given behavior we have seen historically, it is reasonable to expect that these incentives will total to deflationary after proof of stake, but that is just a side effect rather than a target.

author: liberosist
content: Just to clarify, I didn't mean any person was targeting anything. Rather, all I meant to communicate was: "inflation will turn 0 at X gas price"

author: sky.cactus
content: Yeah, I think inflation is around 0 at 15 nanoeth / gas or less for Proof of Stake.

author: sky.cactus
content: While it is well over 100 I think for Proof of Work?

author: gwintery
content: depends also on the amount of ETH staked IIRC.

author: liberosist
content: At 10M ETH staked, it's indeed ~15 basefee; at 33M it's ~25. With proof-of-work, including beacon chain and uncle rewards, it's ~140 gwei. I'm curious to see where the priority:base ratio settles so we can get better estimates for the actual price users have to pay.

author: sky.cactus
content: You should expect it to settle the same place as gasPrice "settled" previously.
